attributes.action: An MP cannot invest in or profit from tax avoidance schemes/entities.
attributes.background: David Cameron and most likely others have involvement with entities that exist to avoid contributing to taxation. They either directly benefit from this in avoiding tax for themselves or for others, either way it is a gross abuse of the position of MP to be involved in avoiding taxation.
attributes.additional_details: A law could be created that barred anyone from sitting in the commons and the lords who has had any interest in tax avoidance. If it was found, like in the prime ministers case, that they had done so as an MP (or before) they should be discharged from their position.

attributes.action: Parliament to legislate to require employers to reply to all job applications
attributes.background: Increasingly unsuccessful candidates never receive a notification that their application has been unsuccessful which is unacceptable. Looking for a job is stressful and employers should be sensitive to this and  reply to all applicants. It is just common courtesy

attributes.action: Scrap cash benefits and bring in 'Welfare Vouchers' that are monetary value.
attributes.background: Introduce a welfare voucher for individuals, couples and families alike which will replace the benefits that they are on. No one will be out of pocket as they will get exactly the same amount of monetary value, based on their circumstances
attributes.additional_details: The government could work in partnership with all the major retailers like ASDA, Sainsbury’s, Morrison’s, Tesco etc. Supermarkets can claim the money back from their local authority, it will be similar to the healthy start vouchers, but on a bigger scale.  Help stop wasting tax payers money, by people spending our tax money on scratchcards alcohol and cigarettes. Buying stuff they actually need. The welfare voucher will restrict by not being able to buy scratchcards with them and limit how much cigarettes and alcohol they can buy with them as well.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for public institutions to recycle
attributes.background: Most public institutions, including some sectors of the NHS and many school and colleges across the UK don't recycle. This can lead to much paper and plastic waste, we normally recycle at home, being taken to landfill instead.
attributes.additional_details: In the average school, 500 plastic bottles are used a day, ending in landfill. Alongside this is the countless sheets of paper and card thrown away by schools. The NHS similarly has little are no recycling bins for public use. This is replicated in parks and towns across the country, with all the plastic and paper waste we use when in public going to landfill, when it could, and should, be recycled.

attributes.action: Make openly threatening the stability of UK society in public a criminal offence
attributes.background: Being British is about respect and tolerance; public use of hateful language, threats, actions and gestures aimed against UK society and values is becoming too common; it can be seen in media almost daily around the UK and is getting far worse. This causes fear and division and should be illegal.

attributes.action: Adjust financial exemption on Fiancé and Spouse visas to include ESA
attributes.background: I am currently in receipt of ESA and I am forbidden to marry my Russian fiancé, or to bring her over if we manage to wed abroad, because I do not meet financial restrictions imposed by the Home Office. My disability truly hinders my ability to meet the demands.
attributes.additional_details:
Fiancé and Spouse visas require the sponsor, the British partner, to either earn 18.6k or have 62.5k in savings of more than six months. If in receipt of a disability allowance the sponsor is exempt from these restrictions, and although ESA is considered a disability allowance, it is not considered so by the Home Office who do not feel it justifies exemption. 

Yet another example of inequalities imposed upon the disabled people of Britain.

https://www.gov.uk/browse/benefits/disability

attributes.action: Protect in law the right to have your birthday off work.
attributes.background: Birthdays only come once a year and often in the business of work home life imbalance,  special occasions which should be enjoyed and embraced by families are kicked to the curb!

attributes.action: Vaccinate all children against the ACWY strain of meningitis
attributes.background: My son contracted the Men W strain of meningococcal septacimia at age 20 months in April 2015, he was extremely poorly and got turned away from 3 health professionals as having a virus until I went by my cut instinct and took him to the children's hospital. He had no rash and we almost lost him.
attributes.additional_details:
Cases of meningitis and septicaemia due to Men W have been increasing in England, from 22 cases in 2009 to 117 in 2014. The increase seems to be speeding up in 2015, caused by an aggressive strain of the bug. But it's fatal in about 1 in 10 cases and can lead to long-term health problems.
Men W infections are particularly severe and usually need to be treated in intensive care. They have a higher death rate than the more common Men C and Men B strains.

attributes.action: Cap Benefits for a maximum of 3 kids starting from the day of implementation.
attributes.background: Lets deter people from having kids for benefit reasons. By capping benefits at three kids we can reduce the benefit bill, stop people from taking advantage of the system.

attributes.action: If Trump is elected President the UK should cut all diplomatic ties with the US.
attributes.background: If trump implements any of the policies he has announced, denying non US Citizen Muslims entry to the country, allowing torture, the killing of terrorist's families etc etc.  The UK Government should recall its ambassador, cut all ties and designate the US a 'Rogue State"

attributes.action: KEEP current tax allowances on the 25% lump sum and contributions for pensions
attributes.background:
Currently pension contributions are paid from your income BEFORE it is taxed.  And when you take your pension, you can take 25% of it tax free. 
The chancellor is considering changing this IN THE16th MARCH BUDGET so that the 25% is taxed AND tax is taken BEFORE you contribute into your pension.
attributes.additional_details:
If this is implemented your contributions into a pension may be taxed BEFORE you contribute thus reducing how much you can save or increasing the tax on your income.
Similarly the entire pot may be taxed when you take it! 
Pension pots take years to accrue and changes can be devastating especially to people near retirement.
Even if you have taken your pension this would affect your family and friends.
We need to tell the chancellor to STOP MESSING WITH PEOPLES PENSIONS.

attributes.action: Stop Landlords refusing DSS
attributes.background:
I see a lot of people struggling to get a flat, or house, due to the Landlord refusing to accept DSS. It does not matter whether the Landlord knows the circumstances as to why DSS is required!

Stop the discrimination - Stop allowing Landlords the right to refuse DSS claimants as tenants!

attributes.action: To implement a minimum wage for people under the age of 16.
attributes.background: This is part of a GCSE Citizenship campaign that is to bring about change in society. We are a group of 14 and 15 year olds that feel the need to make a change. This campaign is worth supporting because it is to bring about equality and make a change in society.

attributes.action: Abolish PFI contracts in the NHS
attributes.background: The nhs is being privatised and 7% goes to private equaty groups.

attributes.action: Link University Tuition Fees to the Hours Required for a Degree and Minimum Wage
attributes.background: Currently, university costs most full time students £9000, which for students aged 21+ would take them 1343 hours to earn and 1698 hours for 18-20 year olds on minimum wage, the rate a lot of students earn at. Whilst contact hours are variable across institutions, subjects and years of study ...
attributes.additional_details: the hours that are required to earn the degree are reasonably consistent and the vast majority of the time advertised at the beginning of the course. 100 hours of work, be it in lectures, completing assignments etc. are often required for 10 credits, and 120 credits are typically undertaken each year. We ask the government to link tuition fees to the hours of work put in and the minimum wage so that students are charged no more than they would earn on minimum wage working for the same duration.

attributes.action: Create UK specific symbol that represents visible and non-visible disabilities.
attributes.background: The International Symbol of Accessibility (ISA) - Wheelchair Symbol - is often confused being representative of all disabilities. This can, itself, cause discrimination for people with non-visible disabilities e.g. mental-ill health. A UK symbol to sit alongside the ISA would be a powerful message.
attributes.additional_details: Much has been learnt about symbolism and imagery. The UK are world leaders in addressing this in terms of equality. It would therefore be advantageous to make the final step to acknowledging all disabilities.. Paving the way for a future-proofed global emblem, coupled with positive communications tackling negative attitudes experienced by many when benchmarked against physical/visible conditions. Complimenting the current accessible symbol would start us down that path.

attributes.action: Allow dogs to visit consenting long staying patients in hospitals.
attributes.background: Research in America has demonstrated the uplifting effects experienced by both patients and staff when dogs are allowed to wander around hospital corridors and wards.
attributes.additional_details:
Dogs probably will not directly help a human to recover from illness, but dogs make humans happy. And feeling happy does make humans more likely to recover from illness.

The petitioner has been unable to find evidence of any diseases which are carried by dogs being transmitted to humans. 

How many diseases can you think of which a dog can transmit to a human during a hospital visit?

How many diseases can you think of which a human can transmit to a human during a hospital visit?

attributes.action: Classify the laser pointer as an 'offensive weapon'
attributes.background: Following laser attacks on hundreds of civil aircraft, including Virgin Atlantic flight VS025 which was forced to return to Heathrow Airport, we call upon the government to classify the laser pointer as an offensive weapon. The mis-use of these devices put hundreds of lives at risk on a daily basis.

attributes.action: That MPs should work full time as an MP and not have outside jobs.
attributes.background: A large number of MPs appear to have numerous second jobs. My view is that being an MP should be a full time job. If they can find time to do many other jobs then they should be paid pro rata. If they have time to do other jobs then perhaps they shouldn't be an MP.
attributes.additional_details: I am also fed up of watching parliament in progress with hardly any MPs in the chamber.They are answerable to the public as they are paid out of taxes and as such are public employees. Very few employees in the public sector are allowed to have second jobs, so why should they be allowed to be able to do this.

attributes.action: for the government to provide funding , equipment and the specialist staff
attributes.background: my wife died in st Thomas hospital in London i want the nhs to stop the practice of sending patients from kent to London.
attributes.additional_details: people in kent should be treated in there local hospitals and not sent to st Thomas in London,the government should provide funding,equipment and the specialist staff to hospitals in kent

attributes.action: Enable better access to emergency funding for academies awaiting a pupils EHCP
attributes.background: Currently academies cannot access emergency funding to give special needs children support above the statutory 13 hours and the wait time for an EHCP is far too long without an emergency provision. With the government push to make schools gain academy status this is leaving SEN children underfunded
attributes.additional_details: Gaining an EHCP to access funding for an SEN child is a complicated and long process, leaving months in the interim with no funding for support. Early years settings can get emergency funding for these situations, as can non academy schools, but with the government push for schools to become academies, children are getting lost in the gaps, leaving schools underfunded and understaffed for children with SEN. Allowing emergency funding for academies is desperately needed

attributes.action: Bring State Pension To 63 years of age ,Bring it Down From 65 Years Age To 63
attributes.background: To bring the Basic State Pension to a level that lifts pensioners out of poverty Early.Bring the age down where many people can enjoy they pension and have good time
attributes.additional_details: We want a pension fit for purpose that takes pensioners off means testing, allows enough money to ‘Eat and Heat’ without constantly worrying.And enjoying them selves

attributes.action: Ban trucks and  commercial vehicle from roads at peak times
attributes.background: When I am commuting daily during office hours and school run, I see much of the traffic slowed down due to heavy vehicles like trucks. If they were asked not to run during 7.30 am -9.30 am and then between 3 pm -5 pm , I think it would go a long way in reducing the traffic congestion.

attributes.action: Censor and ban IS 'recruiting' websites
attributes.background:
Young people are influenced by things they see online - the glories of joining and supporting IS. The government needs to work harder to censor this material, keeping our children safe from recruiting websites.
Terrorism isn't just actions, it's a movement - this starts with ideas put into minds.

attributes.action: Have a new runway at both Gatwick and Heathrow
attributes.background: If this Government decides on one or other it won't be long before we'll have the whole debate again. Having spare capacity at both airports will be an operational relief and set us up for the next decades.

attributes.action: Stop the spending of £1.9million taxpayers money on a pointless wall in Calais.
attributes.background: The UK government invested over £20million of tax payers money reinforcing UK border security at the port of Calais in 2014. Stop them investing a further £1.9million on a pointless wall.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK government and Calais mayor want to build a 4m high border wall around the ferry port at Calais to the tune of £1.9million of UK tax money. This would drastically affect the safety of refugees trying to cross into the UK who would have to face further devastatingly dangerous situations. The wall would also present the first border wall to be erected in Europe since the Berlin wall.

Please sign this petition if you agree we should be seeking better solutions than building pointless walls.

attributes.action: Extend basic rate gift aid to all donations made by private individuals.
attributes.background: Gift aid is allowable on donations by UK taxpayers. Donations made by non taxpayers, which are often a larger proportion of their income should be encouraged by the government. This small gesture would do so at little cost to the exchequer.

attributes.action: more support for parents with mental health, stop removing children
attributes.background: I have borderline personality disorder and because of a relapse and time in hospital, I had my children removed and placed in care. This was meant to be until I got better but they are still not home despite a return to good health and the children begging to be back. I am now fighting for them
attributes.additional_details: Too many children are removed based on a parent having mental health problems. I had mine taken despite social services saying I was a good mum and commending me on my parenting. All assessments have been positive but the psychological report paints a bad picture of people with mental health. How is removing children unless they were physically or sexually abused, benefitting children and their parents? More support in the home is needed for those that can be a good parent with help.

attributes.action: Legally require force food suppliers to label all halal blessed/slaughtered meat
attributes.background:
I am not Muslim, i do not wish to eat halal meat, l do not agree with it religiously & ethically, i support animal rights.
I have accidentally eaten halal meat and this caused me religious and ethical issues and has deeply offended me, i demand ALL shops clearly label halal blessed/slaughtered meat
attributes.additional_details:
Tesco- "we do not specify to suppliers whether halal practices should be followed"
M&S-  "we do not specify any religious practice as part of our sourcing policy so therefore do not label"

Sainsburys- "in NZ it is common for lamb to be blessed"

Morrisons- "all our lamb from NZ is pre-stunned and blessed"

Co-Op- "there is currently no UK wide labelling scheme"

ASDA- "No comment"

Waitrose- " there is currently no UK labelly scheme and we believe this is a matter where government should lead "

attributes.action: Protect the original terms of students loans in statutory law
attributes.background: Students plan their financial future according to the terms of student loans.  The fragility of these terms was exposed by the recent freeze of the repayment threshold.  Prevent current and future governments betraying the trust of students with statutory protection of student loan terms.
attributes.additional_details: Student loans as of 2011/12 were based on a number of terms, including 9% rate of pay back over earning threshold of £21k, write-off of debt after 30 years. None of these terms are safeguarded in law meaning government can retrospectively change the terms of the loan, as evidenced to the recent freeze of earning threshold (see Alex True's petition). Imagine what an increase in the pay back rate would mean for your or your child's future. Google Sutton Trust's "Unfair deal" report.

attributes.action: Make Bullying illegal in the UK
attributes.background: Children are being permanently damaged but the affect of bullying it is morally wrong we as the people should be more vigilant in protecting our youth from the pain and forever damage bullying causes bullying needs to be illegal in all of its area from the simple name calling to the abuse
attributes.additional_details:
a on going debate on whether it should be illegal http://www.debate.org/opinions/should-bullying-be-illegal

http://www.teenink.com/opinion/school_college/article/331577/Should-There-Be-a-Law-Against-Bullying/

attributes.action: Debit card charges to be set at a fair level and charges itemised on  reciept .
attributes.background:
Shop can currently charge what ever they like if a card is used .
goverment should set a max fee and ensure the fee charged is itemised on reciept

attributes.action: Harsher punishments for people who discriminate.
attributes.background: Hate crime is on the rise. There was 4,345 cases of homophobic hate crime in 2011/12 and there was 5,597 cases in 2014/15. These criminals only get a fine or a short prison sentence for their crimes, this has to be changed.
attributes.additional_details: I know myself what it is like to be discriminated and disrespected, its an awful feeling and makes you question yourself and your existence.

attributes.action: Make accusing someone of been a racist without hard evidence a criminal offence.
attributes.background: In light of the recent EU referendum decision and increase in reports of hate crimes, a lot of innocent, decent and hardworking people like myself have been victims of accusations suggesting (with no proof or evidence to support their claims) that people who voted to leave the EU are somehow racist.
attributes.additional_details:
Branding someone as racist without any categorical evidence what so ever also seems to be a tactic that is becoming more of a problem in political and also everyday situations. 

Certain demographics of people are using this tactic to persecute other demographics of people in order to silence their personal views or beliefs to further their own personal or political agendas.

Been racist is a disgusting crime and been wrongly accused with no evidence can be permanently damaging to peoples lives.

attributes.action: Establish and fund a national Hate Crime Task Force.
attributes.background: Parliament should form and fund a national hate crime task force to tackle the unprecedented rise in hate related crime and incidents against minority groups, since the vote to leave the EU. Police and the Judiciary should be provided all necessary resources to investigate and prosecute offences.
attributes.additional_details: Leave or Remain - Not in our name. We have seen a startling rise in both reported and unreported acts of hatred and violence towards sections of our communities "identified" by offenders as "Non-British". Whilst millions of British people may have voted to leave the EU, they do not, and would never, condone this behaviour. We all, and our government has an irrefutable responsibility to challenge and prevent these deplorable acts, with all the force of the law.

attributes.action: No fees for parents who wish to know info about their kids from social services
attributes.background: When couples separate, it's very difficult to iron out the terms when it comes to children and many end up in court. For a non residential parent, they must apply for information from social services and then pay a fee to get written information. None can be given by phone
attributes.additional_details: Bromley Council was contacted by a father to ask what is happening with he's daughter, as court cafcass reports stated problems with the health and education of he's child.  Social services said he must apply for freedom of information by form on their website. The letter he recieved back stated he needs to pay £10 fee plus obtain documents such as birth certificate for he's child. The mother has this so he also has to buy he's own at a cost. This info should be free once ID or rights proven

attributes.action: Use motorway matrix signs to say "Keep left unless overtaking."
attributes.background: This could be used where appropriate to remind drivers that are driving in centre lanes to move over. Thus helping traffic flow.

attributes.action: Accept & publish on website all Petitions associated with UK EU referendum
attributes.background:
Little debate in parliament regarding all the implications of the UK leaving EU prior 23 June 2016 Referendum

UK petition website should accept all submitted petitions regardless of whether assessor assumes similar to another petition. Exiting EU is highly complex all petitions require debate.
attributes.additional_details:
Citizens should have been aware of positives & negatives of UK leaving EU prior voting

Petition assessor rejected "Agree in leaving the EU, negotiate continued Free Movement for All UK citizens."
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/157571
Petition rejected grounds claiming similar to another petition  https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/135700

All EU referendum petitions need open debate. Simply rejecting petitions on assumption similar when issues highly complex is undemocratic.

attributes.action: Make non-payment of rent a criminal offence
attributes.background: Landlords need protection from unscrupulous people who refuse to pay their rent knowing the law is in favour of the tenant. Not only will they  continue to live rent free sometimes for up to a year but they will often trash the property rendering it uninhabitable and then move doing the same again.
attributes.additional_details: Unscrupulous tenants deliberately fail to pay their rent knowing that the legal processes of eviction are long and tedious,They take advantage of this often causing serious damage to a property while the landlord is waiting for legal processes to take effect. These types often cause conflict with neighbours and no-one can take them to task over it. When they are eventually evicted they repeat the process elsewhere  without paying a penny towards their debt or being held accountable for damage.

attributes.action: Rejecting Brexit - find a better alternative to leaving the EU.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to refrain from invoking Article 50. Instead we call upon you to work with the other 27 EU members to find a solution to the issues associated with the free movement of people throughout the EU and, if necessary, to subsequently hold a second EU referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
A key issue for many who voted to leave the EU is unlimited migration of EU citizens into the UK. The issue of migration within the EU impacts countries beyond the UK and must be addressed by the EU as a whole to prevent further countries voting to leave.

If the UK were to leave the EU around half the UK population would still be left dissatisfied. By contrast, we believe that the UK remaining in a reformed EU could satisfy a significantly larger majority of the UK population.

attributes.action: Improve young voter turnout: polling stations in universities and colleges
attributes.background: Young voters are statistically proven to have a poorer turnout to elections than older voters, despite having to live longer with the results. In order to improve young voter turnout, improving accessibility to polling stations by putting them in educational institutions ought to be considered.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.economist.com/blogs/economist-explains/2014/10/economist-explains-24

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/jun/28/young-people-bad-voting-millennials-eu-vote-politics

https://next.ft.com/content/1ce1a720-ce94-3c32-a689-8d2356388a1f

attributes.action: If a petition gets 250,000 signatures, it should trigger a national referendum
attributes.background:
Engagement with politics is continuing to decline. Direct democracy is part of the solution. 

When an official petition receives around 250,000 signatures, it should result in an official, binding referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
In Switzerland, when around 0.6% of the population signs a petition, it triggers a referendum (https://www.ch.ch/en/referendum/). This system works well in a country of more than eight million people, and there is no reason why it wouldn't work well in the UK.

A committee or group should be set up to administer these petitions so they do not needlessly consume government time. Note that only a small number of petitions a year would receive the needed signatures.

attributes.action: All companies relocating to the EU to pay all tax owing to the exchequer.
attributes.background: Vodafone may quit the UK as a result of the Brexit refrendum. HMRC did a deal with them recently. If any company relocates to within the EU, HMRC must annul any deals made, audit them properly and they must pay all tax owing from the last ten years plus interest immediately.

attributes.action: Call a general election or allow a vote on repealing the Communities Act 1972.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to either call a general election or ensure that there is a vote in parliament for repealing the European Communities Act 1972 before invoking Article 50.
attributes.additional_details:
We feel that you owe the electorate and/or Parliament a choice given that :-

Scotland, Northern Ireland, Gibraltar, London and 75% of MPs all voted to remain.

The UK Leave majority was slim, so there is not a strong mandate to leave.

There is currently no leadership in either of the main parties.

There is a constitutional crisis which threatens the breakup of two Unions.

That the defacto leader of the Leave campaign will not stand as PM.

attributes.action: Debate triggering Art.50 and withdrawing from the EU is in the national interest
attributes.background: The referendum result was decided on a narrow percentage majority and already the consequences have been significant. It is the duty of members of the House to consider the national interest and regional and age profile disparity in the results suggests that this is not a settled matter.

attributes.action: Establish support mechanisms to aid people experiencing abuse due to Brexit.
attributes.background: This petition asks Parliament to urgently recommend putting in place visible resources (web, social & phone) so that members of the public who have been subject to abuse related to Brexit know where to turn to seek advice and the support of concerned and loving members of their community.
attributes.additional_details: Reports of members of the public being subjected to racial or xenophobic abuse has increased noticeably since Brexit. Mechanisms exist to report such hate crimes to the police but there is little visible information connecting the victim or scared member o/t public to volunteer groups representing caring individuals in the community or for those who wish to help, to join together. This issue needs a national voice and to be seen as the responsibility of all ordinary decent civilians.

attributes.action: Call for a Public Enquiry into TTIP, CETA & all future Free Trade Agreements.
attributes.background:
The EU and Canada have concluded secret negotiations in the proposed trade agreement CETA, which is now in the process of ratification.

Most commentators believe this constitutes the beginning of the 'race to the bottom' in standards and regulations for food, the environment and public services.
attributes.additional_details:
Included within CETA are the controversial investor-state dispute settlement (ISDS) mechanism and Regulatory Cooperation, which brings international trade harmonisation and greater corporate profits at the expense of public safety. It is said that CETA leaves the back door open for TTIP.

We ask this Enquiry to investigate CETA & TTIP, recommend safeguards for the publics interest in all future UK trade agreements and for legislation to outlaw the practice of secret free trade negotiations.

attributes.action: Create a clear legal framework for UK-wide referenda
attributes.background:
The EU Referendum highlighted the problems of using this democratic tool in the U.K,: a small majority, rejection by two home nations, and purely advisory in nature.
This vagueness, uncertainty, and unfairness is plainly unsatisfactory and must be addressed before any future referenda are held.
attributes.additional_details:
It is proposed that a referendum shall be binding on the Government if either of the following criteria is met:
- The votes for the winning side total at least 50% of the total number of those eligible to vote plus one, or
- The winning side is supported by simple majorities in at least three of the four home nations, and by at least two-thirds of the total votes cast.
In all other cases, the Government shall be required to take note of the result of the referendum, but is not bound by it.

attributes.action: The Government to establish the workings of Article 50 TEU before invocation.
attributes.background: Article 50 of the EU describes the method of how a country leaves the EU. There is insufficient information within the text of the article to properly understand how the mechanics of it would work. The government should seek answers to all outstanding questions prior to invocation.
attributes.additional_details: The biggest outstanding questions is whether or not an article 50 invocation can be withdrawn or not. Others are around the scope of what can be negotiated and what needs to be agreed before the conclusion of article 50. The Government should establish all outstanding questions from the public and seek answers from the EU before article 50 is ever invoked.

attributes.action: Discuss a National Coalition government after the EU referendum result
attributes.background: Britain exiting the EU is the biggest challenge to face the UK since World War Two. Unity is required and there are concerns of a rise in too far to the right politics.
attributes.additional_details: Exiting Europe is the biggest challenge to face the UK since World War Two. A rise in racism and contempt has been reported by immigrants and by people of a minority ethnicity and I feel the British people need reassurances that the goverment won't be led too far right. A Tory lead coalition government with Labour and SNP should be discussed. I feel the coalition will offer stability and offer the best negotiations for the British people when exiting the EU.
